page.title: 14TRAVEL TO GLENLUCE
page.content: The village of Glenluce is split into north and south by a very busy road, the{A75.}This road carries traffic from the port of{STRANRAER}to ports all over the{UNITED KINGDOM.}It is known as the{EURO-ROUTE.}The transport is varied but with a predomination of heavy articulated lorries, between{600 and{700}per day. The constant pressure of traffic has caused many accidents and several{blackspots.}There are three major{blackspots,}one at the eastern end, one at the western end, and one in the centre of the village. It is because of these and the damage that{4000}vehicles a day cause that the village has campaigned for a {BY-PASS }for many many years, to no avail. Traffic is increased in summer because of the influx of tourists to the area thus causing more problems to a very busy road.
